name: Department of Drama
description: George Pierce Baker was the first chairman of the department in its beginnings within the School of Fine Arts.

name: Founding Era
description: The Yale School of Drama was established as a separate professional school in 1955.

name: Robert Brustein
description: Brustein started a “resident professional company” that became the Yale Repertory Theatre. From the beginning, the emphasis has been on challenging work alongside new productions of classic plays. After Brustein, each dean of the School of Drama has had the concurrent role of artistic director of Yale Rep.
